<title level="1" right="Rules">[Faith](/Rules.aspx?ID=2030)</title>

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 18 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
Perhaps you'd like to play a character who is a devout follower of a specific deity. Pathfinder is a rich world with myriad faiths and philosophies spanning a wide pantheon, from [Cayden Cailean](/Deities.aspx?ID=4), the Drunken Hero of good-hearted adventuring; to [Desna](/Deities.aspx?ID=5), the Song of Spheres and goddess of dreaming and the stars; to [Iomedae](/Deities.aspx?ID=9), the Inheritor, goddess of honor, justice, and rulership. Pathfinder's major deities appear on pages 35–39. Your character might be so drawn to a particular faith that you decide they should be a cleric of that deity; they might instead be a lay worshipper who applies their faith's teachings to daily life, or simply the child of devout parents.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
